title: Cardi B appears to confirm Stefon Diggs split at L.A. concert
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Cardi B hints at split from Stefon Diggs during her L.A. concert, mentioning she's not involved with her 'baby daddy.'
Rumors of their breakup arose after the couple unfollowed each other on Instagram post-Super Bowl loss on February 8.
Stefon Diggs faces battery and strangulation charges; a pre-trial hearing is scheduled for April 1 in Massachusetts.

title: UMass ordered to lift suspension for student who organized pro-Palestinian protest
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: UMass Amherst suspended a student for a year after he organized a pro-Palestinian protest during a campus career fair.
Justice Jeffrey Trapani ruled the suspension likely violated the student's First Amendment rights and ordered UMass to lift it.
The protest opposed RTX recruiting on campus, citing the company's production of military technology used by the Israeli military.

title: Hanover police officer charged with motor vehicle homicide in fatal Brockton hit-and-run
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Hanover officer Thomas Hayes, 36, charged with motor vehicle homicide in Brockton hit-and-run of Alfredo Alves, 23.
Hayes allegedly struck Alves while driving friends home from Brockton strip club, later leaving the scene.
Officer placed on leave, due for court March 31; failed to pay increased $15,000 bail after arraignment.

title: Choosing a product that fixes foggy headlights
author: John Paul
bullets: Headlight fogging occurs due to the wearing away of the protective coating, affecting light visibility.
Turtle Wax pads temporarily fixed foggy headlights, but Meguiar’s ceramic coating provides longer-lasting results.
AAA indicates well-maintained headlights can outperform some aftermarket replacements, offering a better light output.

title: Man arrested in Fenway on child rape, human trafficking charges
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Talik Rashaun Garcia, 36, was arrested in Fenway on charges including child rape and human trafficking.
Garcia was arraigned in Boston Municipal Court, pleaded not guilty, and released on a $5,000 bail with conditions.
The arrest followed an investigation by Boston Police and the Massachusetts State Police High-Risk Victims Squad.

title: Man charged with motor vehicle homicide in Pittsfield hit and run that saw victim dragged 4 miles, DA says
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: William Gross, 65, charged with motor vehicle homicide for hit-and-run killing of William Colbert, 69, in Pittsfield.
Colbert was dragged about four miles after being struck near Linden Street/Francis Avenue intersection on February 10.
Gross arrested Monday; arraignment set for Wednesday in Central Berkshire District Court; attorney details not disclosed.

title: Mass. RMV lottery opens for 250th anniversary license plates. Here’s how to apply.
author: Autumn Sloboda
bullets: Massachusetts RMV launches a lottery for 1,000 low-number MA250 commemorative license plates for the state's 250th anniversary.
Applications are open from February 16 to April 17, 2026, for residents with active vehicle registrations through the RMV Online Service Center.
Winners will be announced within five business days after the lottery during the first week of May; no entry fee required.

title: Massachusetts becomes first state to use ChatGPT in the executive branch, drawing criticism
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Massachusetts is implementing ChatGPT as an AI assistant for state employees, starting with the Executive Office of Technology Services and Security.
The AI tool by OpenAI will be securely isolated, preventing state data from being used to train public AI models.
The National Association of Government Employees argues the AI implementation is rushed, fearing job duty reductions for its 15,000 members.

title: Close to 100 jobs lost as 2 Massachusetts packaging plants shut down
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Garlock Flexibles is closing two packaging plants in Gardner, Massachusetts, affecting 91 employees, per a state notice.
The Gardner facilities at 164 Fredette St. and 77 Industrial Rowe will close by September, with some roles retained.
Astara Capital Partners, owner since 2021, acquired the flexible packaging operations and separated them from paper products.

title: Assailant in Pawtucket hockey rink shooting killed ex-wife and son, police confirm
author: Abby Patkin and Molly Farrar
bullets: Robert Dorgan, the assailant in Pawtucket rink shooting, killed his ex-wife Rhonda and son Aidan in a family dispute.
Three additional people, including Rhonda's parents, were injured and remain in critical condition after Monday's shooting.
Robert Dorgan committed suicide at the scene; police continue to investigate his motives and social media activity.
